Post.title: Hello World
Post._content:
Welcome to [Hexo](https://hexo.io/)! This is your very first post. Check [documentation](https://hexo.io/docs/) for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in [troubleshooting](https://hexo.io/docs/troubleshooting.html) or you can ask me on [GitHub](https://github.com/hexojs/hexo/issues).

>   https://cloud.tencent.com/developer/article/1516761
>  https://blog.csdn.net/qq_27437967/article/details/7118957
>

## Quick Start

### Create a new post

``` bash
$ hexo new "My New Post"
```

More info: [Writing](https://hexo.io/docs/writing.html)

### Run server

``` bash
$ hexo server
```

More info: [Server](https://hexo.io/docs/server.html)

### Generate static files

``` bash
$ hexo generate
```

More info: [Generating](https://hexo.io/docs/generating.html)

### Deploy to remote sites

``` bash
$ hexo deploy
```

More info: [Deployment](https://hexo.io/docs/one-command-deployment.html)

title: Hello World

Welcome to [Hexo](https://hexo.io/)! This is your very first post. Check [documentation](https://hexo.io/docs/) for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in [troubleshooting](https://hexo.io/docs/troubleshooting.html) or you can ask me on [GitHub](https://github.com/hexojs/hexo/issues).

## Quick Start

### Create a new post

``` bash
$ hexo new "My New Post"
```

More info: [Writing](https://hexo.io/docs/writing.html)

### Run server

``` bash
$ hexo server
```

More info: [Server](https://hexo.io/docs/server.html)

### Generate static files

``` bash
$ hexo generate
```

More info: [Generating](https://hexo.io/docs/generating.html)

### Deploy to remote sites

``` bash
$ hexo deploy
```

More info: [Deployment](https://hexo.io/docs/one-command-deployment.html)

Post.title: Manjaro command line
Post._content:
## Command Line

-  
  - ls -laR /etc/X11/
- 
  - inxi -G
- 
    - du [-abcDhHklmsSx] [-L <>][-X <>][--block-size][--exclude=<>] [--max-depth=<>][--help][--version][]
    - eg.    sudo du -h --max-depth=1
- smb://ganglion/disk1

## Docker

[https://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/Docker_(%E7%AE%80%E4%BD%93%E4%B8%AD%E6%96%87)](https://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/Docker_())

https://zhuanlan.zhihu.com/p/65696014

https://blog.csdn.net/github_36749622/article/details/83094601



## Colab

https://medium.com/deep-learning-turkey/google-colab-free-gpu-tutorial-e113627b9f5d

https://juejin.im/post/5c05e1bc518825689f1b4948

- GPU

- 

```bash
!apt-get install -y -qq software-properties-common python-software-properties module-init-tools
!add-apt-repository -y ppa:alessandro-strada/ppa 2>&1 > /dev/null
!apt-get update -qq 2>&1 > /dev/null
!apt-get -y install -qq google-drive-ocamlfuse fuse
from google.colab import auth
auth.authenticate_user()
from oauth2client.client import GoogleCredentials
creds = GoogleCredentials.get_application_default()
import getpass
!google-drive-ocamlfuse -headless -id={creds.client_id} -secret={creds.client_secret} < /dev/null 2>&1 | grep URL
vcode = getpass.getpass()
!echo {vcode} | google-drive-ocamlfuse -headless -id={creds.client_id} -secret={creds.client_secret}

!mkdir -p drive
!google-drive-ocamlfuse drive
```
```
import os

path = "/content/drive/OpenNMT/...(dirs...)"
os.chdir(path)
os.listdir(path)
```


- anacondaconda env
```
https://facebookresearch.github.io/TensorComprehensions/installation_colab_research.html
```






## Vim

[vim for python](https://realpython.com/vim-and-python-a-match-made-in-heaven/#verifying-your-vim-install)

####  . sp / vs 

- sp / vs  <tab> 

-  sp  <filename>

- vs <filename>

#### . ls / b 

- :ls 

- b <buffer nubmer> 

#### . 

- .vimrc: nnoremap <space> za
- Plugin 'tmhedberg/SimpylFold'



## Git

http://www.ruanyifeng.com/blog/2015/12/git-cheat-sheet.html

![img](http://www.ruanyifeng.com/blogimg/asset/2015/bg2015120901.png)

#### 

```bash
# Git
$ git init

# Git
$ git init [project-name]

# 
$ git clone [url]
```

#### 

Git`.gitconfig`

```bash
# Git
$ git config --list
 
# Git
$ git config -e [--global]
 
# 
$ git config [--global] user.name "[name]"
$ git config [--global] user.email "[email address]"
```

#### /

```bash
# 
$ git add [file1] [file2] ...

# 
$ git add [dir]

# 
$ git add .

# 
# 
$ git add -p

# 
$ git rm [file1] [file2] ...

# 
$ git rm --cached [file]

# 
$ git mv [file-original] [file-renamed]
```

#### 

```bash
# 
$ git commit -m [message]

# 
$ git commit [file1] [file2] ... -m [message]

# commit
$ git commit -a

# diff
$ git commit -v

# commit
# commit
$ git commit --amend -m [message]

# commit
$ git commit --amend [file1] [file2] ...
```

#### 

```bash
# 
$ git branch

# 
$ git branch -r

# 
$ git branch -a

# 
$ git branch [branch-name]

# 
$ git checkout -b [branch]

# commit
$ git branch [branch] [commit]

# 
$ git branch --track [branch] [remote-branch]

# 
$ git checkout [branch-name]

# 
$ git checkout -

# 
$ git branch --set-upstream [branch] [remote-branch]

# 
$ git merge [branch]

# commit
$ git cherry-pick [commit]

# 
$ git branch -d [branch-name]

# 
$ git push origin --delete [branch-name]
$ git branch -dr [remote/branch]
```

#### 

```bash
# tag
$ git tag

# tagcommit
$ git tag [tag]

# tagcommit
$ git tag [tag] [commit]

# tag
$ git tag -d [tag]

# tag
$ git push origin :refs/tags/[tagName]

# tag
$ git show [tag]

# tag
$ git push [remote] [tag]

# tag
$ git push [remote] --tags

# tag
$ git checkout -b [branch] [tag]
```

#### 

```bash
# 
$ git status

# 
$ git log

# commitcommit
$ git log --stat

# 
$ git log -S [keyword]

# commitcommit
$ git log [tag] HEAD --pretty=format:%s

# commit""
$ git log [tag] HEAD --grep feature

# 
$ git log --follow [file]
$ git whatchanged [file]

# diff
$ git log -p [file]

# 5
$ git log -5 --pretty --oneline

# 
$ git shortlog -sn

# 
$ git blame [file]

# 
$ git diff

# commit
$ git diff --cached [file]

# commit
$ git diff HEAD

# 
$ git diff [first-branch]...[second-branch]

# 
$ git diff --shortstat "@{0 day ago}"

# 
$ git show [commit]

# 
$ git show --name-only [commit]

# 
$ git show [commit]:[filename]

# 
$ git reflog
```

#### 

```bash
# 
$ git fetch [remote]

# 
$ git remote -v

# 
$ git remote show [remote]

# 
$ git remote add [shortname] [url]

# 
$ git pull [remote] [branch]

# 
$ git push [remote] [branch]

# 
$ git push [remote] --force

# 
$ git push [remote] --all
```

#### 

```bash
# 
$ git checkout [file]

# commit
$ git checkout [commit] [file]

# 
$ git checkout .

# commit
$ git reset [file]

# commit
$ git reset --hard

# commit
$ git reset [commit]

# HEADcommitcommit
$ git reset --hard [commit]

# HEADcommit
$ git reset --keep [commit]

# commitcommit
# 
$ git revert [commit]

# 
$ git stash
$ git stash pop
```

#### 

```bash
# 
$ git archive
```



## pacman

`sudo pacman-mirrors --fasttrack && sudo pacman -Syyu`

``pacman -S package_name        #   
pacman -S extra/package_name  # 
pacman -Syu                   # yyyu
pacman -Ss string             # 
pacman -Si package_name       # 
pacman -Sc                    # /var/cache/pacman/pkg
pacman -R package_name        # 
pacman -Rs package_name       # 
pacman -Qs string             # 
pacman -Qi package_name       # 
pacman -Ql package_name       # 
pacman -U package.tar.zx      # 
pactree package_name          # ``



pacman -Q
virtualbox

pacman -Q virtualbox
virtualbox

pacman -Qi virtualbox
virtualbox

pacman -Ql virtualbox


pacman -Qo /etc/passwd


pacman -Sg


pacman -Sg gnome
virtualbox

pacman -Ss virtualbox
virtualbox

**pacman -Si virtualbox**
****

**sudo pacman -Sy**
****

**sudo pacman -Su**
****

**sudo pacman -Syu**
****

sudo pacman -Sy virtualbox
virtualbox

sudo pacman -S virtualbox
virtualbox

sudo pacman -Sf virtualbox
virtualbox

sudo pacman -R virtualbox


sudo pacman -Rd virtualbox
virtualbox

sudo pacman -Rc virtualbox
virtualbox

sudo pacman -Rsc virtualbox
/var/cache/pacman/pkg

sudo pacman -Sc


sudo pacman -Scc
virtualbox

cd /var/cache/pacman/pkg

sudo pacman -U virtualbox-5.2.12-1-x86_64.pkg.tar.xz
virtualbox

sudo pacman -Su --ignore virtualbox
https://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/Pacman_()

## conda

0.
	conda --version



	conda -V

1.
	conda --help
	conda -h
updateremove
	conda update --help
	conda remove --help
--help-h

2.

	conda env -h


	conda create --name your_env_name
y

python
	conda create --name your_env_name python=2.7
	conda create --name your_env_name python=3
	conda create --name your_env_name python=3.5


	conda create --name your_env_name numpy scipy

python
	conda create --name your_env_name python=3.5 numpy scipy


	conda info --envs
	conda env list


	activate your_env_name


	deactivate 


	conda create --name new_env_name --clone old_env_name 


	conda remove --name your_env_name --all

4.

	conda list


	conda list -n your_env_name


	conda install -n env_name package_name

conda installAnaconda.orgpippipAnacondapippipactivate

5.

	conda clean --all	



## Reboot

.i3/config

~/.zshrc

~/command.md

~~/etc/fstab~~

~/.vimrc

pacman -Qi virtualbox virtualbox

pacman -Ss virtualbox virtualbox

sudo pacman -Sy

sudo pacman -Sf virtualbox virtualbox

sudo pacman -R virtualbox

sudo pacman -Rsc virtualbox /var/cache/pacman/pkg

sudo pacman -Su --ignore virtualbox https://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/Pacman_()

2. conda env -h

python conda create --name your_env_name python=2.7 conda create --name your_env_name python=3 conda create --name your_env_name python=3.5

conda create --name your_env_name numpy scipy

python conda create --name your_env_name python=3.5 numpy scipy

conda info --envs conda env list

activate your_env_name

deactivate

conda create --name new_env_name --clone old_env_name

conda remove --name your_env_name --all

4. conda list

conda list -n your_env_name

conda install -n env_name package_name

conda installAnaconda.orgpippipAnacondapippipactivate

5.

conda clean --all

PPG2Mel Tacotron 2 [32]PPG {1-1}Tacotron 2(characters)one-hot(vector representation)encoder LSTM(hidden representation)decoder LSTM [33]{4->2,3} {1-2}character embeddingenconder LSTM{1,2,3layers} {1-3}DecodermelattentionPreNettwo fully connected layersdecoder LSTM{1,2} {1-4}PostNetmultiple 1-D convolutional layers{4} > {1} Tacotron 2![img](/images/20190212211055433.jpg) {2}(two fully connected hidden layers with the ReLU nonlinearity)PPG-embedding network (PPG PreNet)character-embedding layerPPG-embedding network Tacotron 2PreNetPPGsbottleneck featuresPPG2Mel Figure 2 > {2}PPGs {3}Tacotron 2 PPG41PPGTacotron 2PPG [15]{3-1}PPGPPG2Mel[33] {3-2}PPGs$d_i$decoder LSTM$i$$y_i$($d_i$output)$h = [h_1,...,h_T]$encoderhidden states![](/home/fuu/arch/typ_tmp/f1.png) $s_{i-1}$attention LSTM(i-1)hidden state$g_i$attention context, ![](/images/f2.png) ![](/images/f3.png) attention weightsattention scores $e_{ij}$ ![](/images/f4.png) $v, W, V, U, b$ attention modulelearnable parameters$F$ $k$(1-D)$r$-dims$f_i^j R^k$ $j$ $F$ $a_{i-1}$ ![](/images/f5.png) $w$ ![](/images/f6.png) PPG2Mel ![](/images/f7.png) $G_{mel}$ mel-spectrogram$P_{Decoder}$ $P_{PostNet}$ decoderafter linear projection) PostNet$G_{stop}$ stop token$P_{stop}$ stop token$CE()$ $\alpha, \beta, \gamma$ > {3} > > {3-2} > > {3-2}attention!!! #### 3.3 Mel2speech WaveGlowWaveGlowflow-based[35]melWave Net$\sigma$WaveGlowmelWaveGlowWaveNetWaveGlow[14] ### 4. #### 4.1 *Librispeech corpus*[30]AM960hrs AM5816senones*L2-ARCTIC*^{1}^PPG2MelWaveGlowAudacity[36]L2-ARCTIC*ARCTIC*[37]BDLMCLBF[37] L2-ARCTICARCTIC1132L2-ARCTIC1032505016 KHz8010ms64msmel10msPPG > {-1} > > {1}YKWK (na-tive male Korean speaker) and ZHAA (native female Arabic speaker) from the publicly-available L2-ARCTIC corpus [34]. **Table 1.**PPG2Mel6(batch size)110 -4(learning rate) $\alpha,\beta,\gamma$ 1.01.00.005 $\omega$ 208h WaveGlow[14] $\sigma$ 0.701 $\sigma$ 0.6 3110 -4 Nvidia GTX 1070 GPU KaldiAMPyTorchAdam optimizerhttps://github.com/guanlongzhao/fac-via-ppg > {-2} baseline[9]nativenon-native frames PPGPPGsymmetric KL divergencenativenon-nativeMelMCEPsjoint-density GMMJD-GMMspectral conversion [39]JD-GMMnative MCEPsvoice qualitySTRAIGHT Vocoder[40]MCEPsaperiodicityAPF0(pitch range1032GMM12824MCEPsMCEP010ms25msBDL-YKWKCLB-ZHAA > {-3}baseline system #### 4.2 > [] Mean Opinion Score (MOS) Amazon Mechanical Turk2550 MOS1-bad, 2-poor, 3-fair, 4-good, 5-excellentMOS17L2**Table 2.****Table 3.**[9]MOSDTWJD-GMM0.4JD-GMM MOS()MOSARCTIC$p$=0.35L2-ARCTIC$p$=0.54t 71717**Table 4.**72.47%3.4somewhat confident27.53%1.05 ![](/images/sf6.png) 19[43]185ARCTIC 1.20L2-ARCTIC 7.172.943.93 ![](/images/fa6.png) ### 5. ACSeq2Seq(a modified Tacotron2)PPGsMel-spectrograms(neural vocoder)melPPG-to-Mel(utterance-level)MOSTacotron 2WaveGlowMOS24MOSPPG-to-MelWaveGlow{1} > {1}MOS F0APmel PPG(accentedness){2}AM(acoustic model)PPG{2-1}PPG-to-MelPPGF0(contour) > {2} > > {2}AM > > {2-1} {3}PPG-to-MelWaveGlowTTS{4}ACPPGPPGSeq2SeqPPGPPG2Mel > {3} {3-1} > > {4} {4-1}Seq2Seq ###
